signals.Ask: We need a solution that integrates seamlessly with HubSpot as we are transitioning to it for support.
signals.Evidence: I think financially it makes sense for us just to add this module in versus having yet another like system.

signals.Ask: We require a tool that can support a team structure of multiple agents managing customer queries.
signals.Evidence: We have a whole team both in the US and the U.K.

signals.Ask: We are looking for a cost-effective solution that does not add unnecessary complexity.
signals.Evidence: I think financially it makes sense for us just to add this module in.

signals.Ask: The solution should maintain a conversational experience for customers, similar to email communication.
signals.Evidence: They don't feel like they're in a ticket in another system like it's just like me and you communicating over email.

signals.Ask: The primary user of the support tool should be involved in the evaluation process.
signals.Evidence: Support is a little bit outside my realm. We have someone who like runs the director of client experience and support.

signals.Ask: Hiver must integrate seamlessly with Zendesk.
signals.Evidence: We're pretty invested in Zendesk now.

signals.Ask: The platform should offer advanced AI features for ticket summarization and response suggestions.
signals.Evidence: We have a tool called maven that does ticket summarization and suggests a response.

signals.Ask: Any new solution must justify the transition from existing tools like Maven and Zendesk.
signals.Evidence: We've been debating whether or not we want to continue with maven or start using Zendesk's AI tool.

signals.Ask: The platform should be easy to use compared to current solutions.
signals.Evidence: We have customers that come over from Zendesk for it being hard to use.

signals.Ask: The solution should align with a customer service and support focus.
signals.Evidence: We're going more towards like the customer service, customer support type.

signals.Ask: We need a system that can process client requests like a help desk ticket.
signals.Evidence: I want to change the concept of our interactions with our clients... it actually is processed like a help desk ticket.

signals.Ask: Integration with Microsoft Teams is important for our internal communication.
signals.Evidence: Could Hiver draw from Teams messages to generate tasks like it does from email?

signals.Ask: We require customizable response times for urgent tasks, ideally within 15 minutes.
signals.Evidence: Can you change that to say within 15 minutes? It needs to be like – a.

signals.Ask: We need a centralized location to track completed tasks and associated documents.
signals.Evidence: Is there a spot where, like –, so the document will just be sitting within the message?

signals.Ask: We are looking for additional help desk functionalities beyond email management.
signals.Evidence: I was hoping for more in addition to that functionality sort of a help desk type like task ticketing.

signals.Ask: We need a better way to track our warranty process for products sold.
signals.Evidence: We just need a better way to track our warranty process with products that we sell.

signals.Ask: The system must integrate with Shopify to track ticket statuses and resolutions.
signals.Evidence: Integration... whether or not there's open APIs to maybe connect to Shopify.

signals.Ask: We require support for voice communication as the primary contact method.
signals.Evidence: Our main one that people communicate issues with us is via voice.

signals.Ask: We need the ability to push order statuses and notes back to Shopify.
signals.Evidence: We need to push the status of this order or even notes back to Shopify.

signals.Ask: The system should be scalable to accommodate future team growth.
signals.Evidence: I want to set up a system that will be conducive to scale.

signals.Ask: Need clear visibility on email status, including open, pending, and closed.
signals.Evidence: How do I know what's assigned? How do I know what's unassigned? What status is my email in?

signals.Ask: Require the ability to customize email statuses.
signals.Evidence: Can they set other statuses? Can we custom that Cole?

signals.Ask: Need the ability to create personal and private tags in addition to shared tags.
signals.Evidence: Does that include like private tags as well?

signals.Ask: Require advanced search capabilities with multiple filters and saved views.
signals.Evidence: And you can put multiple filters on to find it, right?

signals.Ask: Need a clear method for tracking user availability status.
signals.Evidence: How do you know if somebody's online or not?

signals.Ask: The AI must provide accurate responses based on uploaded training materials.
signals.Evidence: Hiver gave us this information on the right, which… was incorrect. Basically all of it was incorrect.

signals.Ask: We want a customer-facing AI experience to handle level one support cases.
signals.Evidence: Ultimately, we want a customer facing AI experience that's going to make it easier for us to eliminate… more cases at level one.

signals.Ask: Hiver must integrate seamlessly with Netsuite for case management.
signals.Evidence: We don't want to introduce another source of truth and source of record for any formal emails with customers.

signals.Ask: The AI should suggest relevant knowledge base articles during customer interactions.
signals.Evidence: I would want copilot to not just build the answer himself.

signals.Ask: We need assurance that ongoing adjustments to the AI will not be a recurring burden.
signals.Evidence: I just wonder how this looks long term or will we have to continue to, you know, meet with you guys to tweak every time we roll out a new product line.

signals.Ask: We require detailed analytics on AI interactions and case resolutions.
signals.Evidence: I would want to be able to have analytics on how many questions do we get a day, a week, a month, a quarter?

signals.Ask: The platform must separate email and chat correspondence in the inbox.
signals.Evidence: It doesn't separate those in an inbox, making it next to impossible to organize.

signals.Ask: The solution should allow grouping of contacts under a single company umbrella.
signals.Evidence: It doesn't have the ability to lump contacts into a company.

signals.Ask: There must be a direct integration from the sales CRM into the support CRM.
signals.Evidence: There's no direct integration from our sales CRM into our support CRM.

signals.Ask: The system should provide analytics on average reply times throughout email threads.
signals.Evidence: I would love to be able to see average reply time not just to first response but to even like in a thread.

signals.Ask: A trial period for the solution is necessary before making a final decision.
signals.Evidence: I would really love to... get back to you by the end of next week if we are interested in doing like a trial period.

signals.Ask: Guarantee no price increases until contract expiry.
signals.Evidence: You're good till the contract renews, obviously because we signed it up in advance.

signals.Ask: Desire to test AI features before full implementation.
signals.Evidence: I think you're on the right track with getting the documents there.

signals.Ask: Require customization options for AI responses and workflows.
signals.Evidence: You can either upload documents as they are copy paste snippets or best responses that you want for like specific scenarios.

signals.Ask: Need a robust feedback loop for AI performance improvement.
signals.Evidence: Every agent that interacts with it can keep giving that feedback loop.

signals.Ask: Interest in tracking sentiment on incoming emails.
signals.Evidence: You can tweak it based on prompts.

signals.Ask: We need a more efficient way to manage our busy legal contracts inbox.
signals.Evidence: It's a very busy inbox with a lot of requests coming in.

signals.Ask: The system must provide a reliable search capability across all emails, including closed matters.
signals.Evidence: The search is at the moment inexistent. We cannot find things.

signals.Ask: We require clear visibility on task assignments to ensure accountability.
signals.Evidence: How would the system know which one is my task? Which one is Sarah's task?

signals.Ask: We need access to all historical emails and attachments for context in ongoing matters.
signals.Evidence: We need everything. Yeah, completely.

signals.Ask: The system should provide analytics on email volume and handling times.
signals.Evidence: Does the system give any analytics? Like for example, how many matters closed last year?

signals.Ask: How does Hiver store messages and organize them per client?
signals.Evidence: My question is how does hiver store the messages that's my, that's the big thing I cannot determine how they store the messages, how we would organize it per client.

signals.Ask: We need a solution that allows clients to communicate via email without using Basecamp.
signals.Evidence: Our clients prefer just to email us versus go through basecamp.

signals.Ask: We need to determine how many team members will need access to Hiver.
signals.Evidence: I don't know... we'll have to figure out how many people would actually have to have access to it.

signals.Ask: Can we tag messages based on clients for better organization?
signals.Evidence: Is there a way to tag each message based on a client?

signals.Ask: We want to ensure that all messages are accessible to the team to prevent any from getting lost.
signals.Evidence: I just don't want messages to get lost.

signals.Ask: We want the option for monthly billing instead of annual.
signals.Evidence: We want to do if it's possible the monthly billing.

signals.Ask: We need a refund for the annual charge incurred during the trial period.
signals.Evidence: We got charged the full amount without... the trial period was supposed to end today.

signals.Ask: We require a demo session for our entire customer service and sales team.
signals.Evidence: I just want them to actually feel okay... I wouldn't just want to like hang on to this and let Freshdesk go.

signals.Ask: We need additional time to set up the email routing before fully transitioning.
signals.Evidence: I wanted to get everything sorted before, you know, we actually did the thing, right?

signals.Ask: We are interested in adopting Hiver as our ticketing system.
signals.Evidence: We actually want to have Hiver as our ticketing system.

signals.Ask: We need a solution primarily focused on email management for our reservations team.
signals.Evidence: We want to find a better solution that is, you know, its main purpose is that like Hiver.

signals.Ask: The chosen platform must be scalable to accommodate future growth from 15 to potentially 25 users.
signals.Evidence: We also want to make sure that we can then, you know, move up or ensure that the plan that we pick makes sense for our future.

signals.Ask: We require improved reporting capabilities and visibility on team workload and email assignments.
signals.Evidence: They also want to have a bit more visibility on who's working on what, and have a better auto assignment as well.

signals.Ask: We aim to decommission Dynamics by the end of February and want to start onboarding the new tool as soon as possible.
signals.Evidence: We want to move reasonably quickly to avoid that gap between decommissioning one platform and onboarding to the next.

signals.Ask: We expect comprehensive onboarding and support included in the subscription without additional costs.
signals.Evidence: I assume you don't have any sort of one-off implementation fees.

signals.Ask: There should be no limitations on data storage for email management.
signals.Evidence: There is as such no limitation on data storage as long as your Outlook is processing those emails.

signals.Ask: We want to ensure future integration capabilities with other platforms if needed.
signals.Evidence: If we want to consider in future, is it just the ones you have that I can find on the website?

signals.Ask: We need the ability to create custom reports based on our specific needs.
signals.Evidence: Can we create our own version of reports or is that only a specific plan?

signals.Ask: We would like to have customer satisfaction features included if possible.
signals.Evidence: If it's included in the plan we end up selecting, then it's always nice to have.

transcripts.title: Hiver Trial Check in <> Solar Guys Pro

signals.Ask: Extend the trial period by two to three days.
signals.Evidence: I did want him to have a feel for it for like two or three days.

signals.Ask: Enable tagging and assigning without opening each email.
signals.Evidence: I expected to be able to tag and assign without having to go into the mail itself.

signals.Ask: Gather team feedback on the tool's effectiveness by Tuesday.
signals.Evidence: I want to get the team's feedback in by Tuesday as well just to hear their thoughts.

signals.Ask: Make a decision on adopting the tool based on trial feedback.
signals.Evidence: If we feel like it is working for us and it is helping declutter, then I would say, we would take on hiver almost immediately.

signals.Ask: Provide admin access to the CEO for better tool exploration.
signals.Evidence: I wanted him to actually access the tool and to see if it's actually making a difference.

signals.Ask: We need an AI solution to automatically read and respond to customer emails.
signals.Evidence: We need something automatized that... we cannot do that now.

signals.Ask: We are open to some human intervention for complex queries.
signals.Evidence: We know that the AI has to learn and understand the messages we receive so that it can answer correctly.

signals.Ask: We want to minimize costs and prefer a plan for two users.
signals.Evidence: Our idea is to spend the less money possible.

signals.Ask: We aim to make a decision by next week after evaluating other options.
signals.Evidence: I think on Wednesday, I can have all that information and take the decision.

signals.Ask: The platform must support responses in Spanish.
signals.Evidence: Does it have the option in Spanish?

signals.Ask: We need better visibility of emails that are closed.
signals.Evidence: We've ended up with less visibility now because a lot of the emails are going into assigned and then they're being closed.

signals.Ask: The current SLAs do not work for our logistics email.
signals.Evidence: The SLAs don't really work for us because of the way the logistics email is.

signals.Ask: The conversation view is not functioning effectively for our needs.
signals.Evidence: The conversation view is just not working for us.

signals.Ask: Our small team size makes the platform more burdensome rather than helpful.
signals.Evidence: I feel like it's not really... it's just making it even more work for the team.

signals.Ask: We require a straightforward way to manage email filters and tags.
signals.Evidence: I know it sets up all these filters and tags in the background.

signals.Ask: We need a solution to automate the management of our accounts payables emails.
signals.Evidence: We do not have any solution... everything is outside the system as we speak today.

signals.Ask: We require integration with our existing Microsoft ERP for processing invoices.
signals.Evidence: I don't even know whether that solution exists today.

signals.Ask: We need to evaluate if the solution is suitable for our small team of two people.
signals.Evidence: I personally may not really recommend you looking at a solution because you probably are much better at a phase where you are able to manage.

signals.Ask: We need a way to ensure that no emails are missed or left untagged.
signals.Evidence: What if they only miss to tag something and it just remains untagged.

signals.Ask: We would like to explore a freemium plan to test the solution before committing.
signals.Evidence: You can have one payable inbox invite two people... without even incurring any cost.

signals.Ask: The UX for the warehouse system must be user-friendly.
signals.Evidence: The UX graphic for the warehouse is not user friendly.

signals.Ask: Internal communication between office and warehouse must be improved.
signals.Evidence: Our main problem is communication between the office and the warehouse.

signals.Ask: A solution for managing customer support tickets is required.
signals.Evidence: We were looking for a system that could handle ticketing.

signals.Ask: The solution must integrate with billing and invoicing tools.
signals.Evidence: We need a billing software for invoicing.

signals.Ask: The system should support Italian language for email templates and tags.
signals.Evidence: Can you set up a prayer written email in Italian?

signals.Ask: A mobile app for managing support tickets is necessary.
signals.Evidence: You have a mobile app?

signals.Ask: A trial period of at least one week is required to test the solution.
signals.Evidence: We can test the demo for one max, two weeks.

signals.Ask: The system must allow for easy creation and management of an internal knowledge base.
signals.Evidence: I just want to create a system where we can respond very quickly to the emails.

signals.Ask: The tool should enable quick responses to customer emails by integrating with our existing email system.
signals.Evidence: I wanted a tool which helps us initially at least for the ticketing purpose.

signals.Ask: The system must support automation to filter and close non-actionable emails.
signals.Evidence: There are a couple of emails which does not require our like mostly someone like notification.

signals.Ask: We need to start with a minimum of two user licenses for the tool.
signals.Evidence: Initially, we'll go ahead with the two.

signals.Ask: The tool should integrate seamlessly with our existing Gmail setup without forwarding emails to a separate server.
signals.Evidence: I can't like because all the sent messages also, I can't have a track.

signals.Ask: We need a solution that allows team members to assign email threads to themselves or others within Gmail.
signals.Evidence: I want every single person on my team to continue to work within their workflows, which is Gmail, and to be able to assign threads to themselves or to different people.

signals.Ask: We require assurance that sensitive customer data will be securely handled and not exposed.
signals.Evidence: I do want to like double click into security features... we're a mortgage company and we're taking mortgage applications.

signals.Ask: We are looking for a lightweight solution to improve our email management without needing advanced analytics immediately.
signals.Evidence: In the short term, we may eventually want to install a full service platform... but what we want to do is install a Gmail tool.

signals.Ask: We want the ability to integrate AI for drafting and editing emails based on our communication guidelines.
signals.Evidence: We should throw everything into like a chat gpt type instance that is like programmed with our communication guidelines.

signals.Ask: We need clear information on pricing and the ability to trial the product before making a commitment.
signals.Evidence: I just want to proactively get it, you know? ... I do want to move forward relatively quickly.

signals.Ask: We need to optimize Julian's inbox for automations to handle repetitive tasks.
signals.Evidence: We really want to optimize Julian's inbox for automations because he does have a lot of repetitive tasks.

signals.Ask: We require a better way to manage emails across shared inboxes to avoid confusion.
signals.Evidence: We all kind of access it just to make sure that if one person has reached out just to follow the threads that are going on.

signals.Ask: We need to ensure that follow-up automations do not send duplicate emails.
signals.Evidence: Both the auto replies went out at the same time, which was not our intention.

signals.Ask: Julian needs to work out of his personal email to manage shared inboxes effectively.
signals.Evidence: Julian should have the same view that you're seeing... he needs to start working out of assigned to me.

signals.Ask: We need to create a Google group for the afu inbox to streamline email management.
signals.Evidence: If we're hiring this third person and they're also going to work out of the same inbox, we will actually need to separate you from that afu inbox.

transcripts.title: Asset Plan | Hiver - Elite upgrade next steps

signals.Ask: We prefer a month-to-month contract but are open to an annual contract with monthly payments.
signals.Evidence: we would prefer a monthly month to month contract, but we understand that you guys have your way of working internally

signals.Ask: We need a discount if we agree to the annual contract at $55 per user.
signals.Evidence: we would expect a discount in case we do that

signals.Ask: Our budget for this tool is set below $45 per user.
signals.Evidence: we actually set something below 45… already good enough

signals.Ask: We want to avoid involving a third-party negotiator in this process.
signals.Evidence: I would love to avoid to, for them to get it getting like get on board with this negotiation

signals.Ask: We would like to compartmentalize the AI features discussion for a later date.
signals.Evidence: we can move really fast right now and sign the annual contract. And in three months for now, we can discuss about upgrading AI

signals.Ask: We require a faster customer support response time, ideally within hours, not days.
signals.Evidence: The customer mentioned that support usually takes at least 48 hours to reply.

signals.Ask: We need assurance of high system uptime and reliability.
signals.Evidence: The customer expressed dissatisfaction with their current platform's frequent downtimes.

signals.Ask: We need confirmation that the platform can integrate with third-party services like Zapier and Jira.
signals.Evidence: The customer stated they need a way to integrate with Circle and mentioned using Jira.

signals.Ask: We are looking for a more competitive pricing model compared to our current solution.
signals.Evidence: The customer expressed they are not happy with the pricing of their current solution.

signals.Ask: We aim to make a decision by the end of next week and switch in February.
signals.Evidence: The customer indicated a timeline for decision-making and implementation.

signals.Ask: We need integration with Shopify and Gmail.
signals.Evidence: It would definitely be integration with Shopify.

signals.Ask: The solution must be more budget-friendly than our current provider, Gorgias.
signals.Evidence: Honestly, it's just overpriced for the quality of the system.

signals.Ask: The platform should be simple and easy to navigate.
signals.Evidence: Honestly, I like the simplicity of the platform.

signals.Ask: We want the option to try the service for a month before committing to an annual subscription.
signals.Evidence: Can we do that? Try it out for a month and then lock into an annual subscription?

signals.Ask: 24/7 technical support is a critical requirement.
signals.Evidence: Some of the other platforms I was looking at, they don't have 24 seven support.

transcripts.title: Hiver Demo Park Street Companies<> Cole

signals.Ask: We need a ticketing platform feature to streamline external communication workflows.
signals.Evidence: We're looking to streamline processes, standardize a lot of our workflows when it comes to external communication.

signals.Ask: We require integration with a customer portal for routing inquiries to the appropriate team.
signals.Evidence: We definitely want a system in which we could integrate a customer portal.

signals.Ask: We need the ability to create custom fields and generate analytics based on those fields.
signals.Evidence: Custom field analytics is one that we would be looking to add.

signals.Ask: We need multiple knowledge bases for different departments, not just one.
signals.Evidence: We have different knowledge bases... for us right now, we're functioning with both knowledge bases externally.

signals.Ask: We will take most of Q1 for evaluation before presenting findings to the executive team.
signals.Evidence: We'll probably take the most of Q1 in terms of evaluation and just seeing what is out there.

signals.Ask: We need to have our forms set up before proceeding with the migration.
signals.Evidence: I think we need that set up before anything else is ready.

signals.Ask: I will create all the custom fields in Hiver prior to migration.
signals.Evidence: So then I should go ahead, and create all the custom fields because those won't be here.

signals.Ask: We prefer to kick off the migration on a Wednesday night to avoid disruption during peak times.
signals.Evidence: Our student deadlines is actually on the weekend... midweek Wednesday, Thursday, Friday is actually a little bit calmer.

signals.Ask: We want open and pending tickets to be prioritized during the migration.
signals.Evidence: Those are the ones that we actually want over there first.

signals.Ask: All agent accounts must be created prior to the migration.
signals.Evidence: You'll have to add them as users first.

signals.Ask: We prefer not to commit to a two-year contract due to internal changes.
signals.Evidence: I don't think we're going to be looking for a two year contract.

signals.Ask: We need a lower price point than $65 per person to secure approval.
signals.Evidence: Is there any wiggle room in the 65…

signals.Ask: We need to delete a couple of users before the renewal to fit within the user tier.
signals.Evidence: We currently have 23 full time employees. So a couple of users do need to be deleted.

signals.Ask: Please send a detailed email breakdown of the renewal options.
signals.Evidence: Can you do me a favor and send this to me in an email?

signals.Ask: We want to schedule a follow-up call to discuss new functionalities after the renewal.
signals.Evidence: We would love to set up some time for later... to walk you through some of the additional functionality.

signals.Ask: We need automatic email routing when a colleague is out of office.
signals.Evidence: We want the emails to automatically route to the other person on the team when one of them goes out of the office.

signals.Ask: Shared drafts should be visible in the shared drafts folder.
signals.Evidence: Shared drafts are not showing up in my shared drafts folder.

signals.Ask: We are interested in integrating CSAT functionality into our workflow.
signals.Evidence: I'm curious to learn about CSAT; it sounds like you can crack CSAT in here as well.

signals.Ask: We would like the ability to create templates for automations.
signals.Evidence: It would be a cool feature if you could templatize your automations.

signals.Ask: We need to categorize customers for specific routing based on their email domains.
signals.Evidence: We need to bucket customers into different categories for routing.

signals.Ask: We require a HIPAA compliant email management solution.
signals.Evidence: we are looking for something for email management that is hipaa compliant.

signals.Ask: We need a shared inbox solution for internal communication and stakeholder interactions.
signals.Evidence: we're looking for a shared inbox solution for that specifically.

signals.Ask: We need the solution to be set up quickly due to an overloaded back office.
signals.Evidence: we are looking to get working ASAP.

signals.Ask: We want multiple accounts to share the same email threads.
signals.Evidence: we just want to have multiple accounts, be able to share the same sort of like threads.

signals.Ask: We need the ability to connect with EMRs in the future.
signals.Evidence: Is this connect directly to emrs?

signals.Ask: We need clarity on any additional costs associated with the BAA and the enterprise plan.
signals.Evidence: Is there any additional costs associated with signing a baa besides you said it was, we would have to be on the enterprise plan?

signals.Ask: We want to understand the onboarding process and if a free trial is available.
signals.Evidence: Is there any like free trial involved or anything like that?

signals.Ask: We need better ways to manage a shared inbox to avoid chaos when clients respond.
signals.Evidence: I'd love to see that… not happen. So, you know, like when somebody communicates that it comes back to them specifically.

signals.Ask: We require metrics on first response time, resolution time, and the number of emails assigned and closed.
signals.Evidence: These are ones that I'd want to see first response and resolution time, but also how many emails are assigned and closed is a big one.

signals.Ask: We need integration with Zoho to view related information in Gmail.
signals.Evidence: I believe you guys integrate with Zoho. Is that true?

signals.Ask: A longer trial period than seven days is necessary to evaluate the solution effectively.
signals.Evidence: Seven days? Seems like a short time to see if you like it or get metrics.

signals.Ask: We are not ready to transition from Zoho to Hiver immediately and want to explore other options.
signals.Evidence: We're not jumping to anything. So I don't want to schedule any – anything… next, just curious about costs though.

signals.Ask: I need my own account as the admin instead of using a shared inbox.
signals.Evidence: It would be best if I have my own account overall as the admin rather than use one of those shared inboxes as the admin.

signals.Ask: I want to understand how email synchronization works to avoid duplicate responses.
signals.Evidence: I would like to understand a little better. How does the sync work?

signals.Ask: I need a way to manage spam emails effectively within the shared inbox.
signals.Evidence: I noticed that every once in a while, we do get relevant emails landing into spam.

signals.Ask: I need clarity on the differences between the free and paid plans.
signals.Evidence: I'm not quite sure what I signed up for and what's the difference between each plan.

signals.Ask: I need to know how to set up mobile access for managing shared inboxes.
signals.Evidence: Can you help me out if it can be used on mobile or what I should set up?

signals.Ask: We need a tool that allows us to assign incoming emails to specific team members.
signals.Evidence: I was hoping to find something where it could, you know, auto assign that to jess or to Alex or whoever.

signals.Ask: The solution should support automation based on subject lines to streamline email handling.
signals.Evidence: I realized that there's probably like either programmable codable components to it and or at least at the very least the start of AI inside of, you know, we get the same a lot.

signals.Ask: We require personalized onboarding support to set up the system effectively.
signals.Evidence: If you do pro for at least five users, you are going to get a personalized onboarding support.

signals.Ask: We need reporting features to track team response rates and workload management.
signals.Evidence: I remember reading on your guys site about the… app, helping me track my team's like response rate.

signals.Ask: We need flexible pricing options as we scale our team size.
signals.Evidence: If we were on the pro plan and we do end up adding the extra two individuals probably within the next two months.

signals.Ask: The contact module must allow for the assignment of account representatives to ensure proper client servicing.
signals.Evidence: The contact module not being able to assign an account rep is the issue.

signals.Ask: We need a solution to integrate custom objects with our existing Google Sheets mapping.
signals.Evidence: Our objects are static, and we need to either tie into the Google sheet or provide a script.

signals.Ask: We require clear documentation on what can and cannot be migrated from Zendesk to Hiver.
signals.Evidence: It would be helpful to have some documentation on what parts of it can be migrated, what parts cannot be migrated.

signals.Ask: We need to explore AI chat capabilities as a priority for our customer onboarding.
signals.Evidence: They have a use case for AI chat also.

signals.Ask: We need an integrated setup to manage both phone calls and emails in one place.
signals.Evidence: Their biggest issue right now is they're spending so much time figuring out this phone call and email connection.

signals.Ask: There is a request for WhatsApp as a communication channel in Omni.
signals.Evidence: Valis group is looking for WhatsApp as a channel in Omni.

signals.Ask: We need a solution for migrating knowledge bases from third-party systems to Hiver.
signals.Evidence: We need to figure out how to migrate from their WordPress site.

signals.Ask: We need to ensure that automation workflows are available in Omni to match HIG capabilities.
signals.Evidence: The primary thing automation is something we need.

signals.Ask: We need AI tools to automate ticket qualification and suggest answers to clients.
signals.Evidence: We are looking for some AI tools that we need to use in tickets qualifying maybe to suggest some answers to the clients.

signals.Ask: The solution must integrate with our existing systems like Jira and Salesforce.
signals.Evidence: It sounded like Jira Salesforce are like kind of the two main ones you also use.

signals.Ask: The tool should accommodate language differences among our team and clients.
signals.Evidence: Our RD office is in Minsk... the first language would be Russian and then our clients would be in Spanish and we're communicated in English.

signals.Ask: Please provide a detailed proposal that includes tiered pricing and licensing options.
signals.Evidence: I'd like to see a proposal that includes like, you know, everything that you showed us.

signals.Ask: We prefer a month-to-month plan initially to test the tool before committing to an annual contract.
signals.Evidence: I think the monthly one could work for us at the beginning.

signals.Ask: We need to understand the timeline for migrating ticket history from Zendesk to Hiver.
signals.Evidence: If we can understand that, we can give you a more clear cut timeline.

signals.Ask: We want to determine how far back we should retrieve ticket history for migration.
signals.Evidence: I'm gonna find out from the team, how far they want to go back.

signals.Ask: We need to tie new client domains with the respective client care representatives.
signals.Evidence: We have to be able to tie that domain with the client care rep.

signals.Ask: We need to connect a live sheet for automatic updates of client information.
signals.Evidence: Because they would need that.

signals.Ask: We want to integrate our existing knowledge base with Hiver's system.
signals.Evidence: We would want it to go to Hiver, sure, or that customer portal that you guys have.

signals.Ask: We need assurance that private emails will not be visible to other users in Hiver.
signals.Evidence: I wanted to just confirm that... if somebody emails them directly, that's private.

signals.Ask: The AI must consistently provide accurate information from the knowledge base.
signals.Evidence: I just want the accuracy to be fixed.

signals.Ask: The AI should avoid providing unnecessary information in its responses.
signals.Evidence: Sometimes it does give like it gives the right answer and then it gives other information that I didn't need.

signals.Ask: We need the AI to work effectively without requiring extensive testing from our team.
signals.Evidence: We feel like we're doing a lot of testing and we kind of just need it to work.

signals.Ask: We want to implement features that allow us to fine-tune the AI's responses ourselves.
signals.Evidence: When you're done, you can teach me how to do it myself.

signals.Ask: We need to share our knowledge base documents for testing and fine-tuning.
signals.Evidence: I can email this to you and then I'll CC Jordan on it.

signals.Ask: Extend the trial period to February 8th.
signals.Evidence: We were not able to connect the two inboxes yet, but we are hoping to do this by end of today or maybe tomorrow.

signals.Ask: Provide training for team members to effectively use the tool.
signals.Evidence: Not everyone is that great at computers.

signals.Ask: Negotiate pricing to accommodate budget constraints.
signals.Evidence: If we can come to some agreement on the price that'd be great.

signals.Ask: Connect real inboxes for proper testing before full adoption.
signals.Evidence: We actually need to connect the real inboxes to actually allow them to use it properly to test.

signals.Ask: Establish a process for gathering team feedback during the trial.
signals.Evidence: If you have questions from the team as well, feel free to bring them on to the meeting.
